Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lets say CSW was involved, so sanity and intelligence are not in play

Author: zack#6467
Content: I guess I would make a futarchy market asking if it is a good idea to consider this an attack, and to freeze all the money on both sides of the oracle by preventing that oracle from ever closing.

Author: zack#6467
Content: if the futarchy market says we should freeze the money, then we would.

Author: zack#6467
Content: then CSW wouldn't be incentivized to mess with Amoveo any more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by what justification to just confiscate the funds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems very draconian

Author: zack#6467
Content: Amoveo uses futarchy governance

Author: zack#6467
Content: if futarchy tells us to do any hard update or change anything, then we do

Author: zack#6467
Content: we don't have hierarchy

Author: zack#6467
Content: futarchy is the ideal way for communities to make good decisions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this 50% ambiguity is indeed the worst case chain split event, effectively an attack. I guess it could just also be reversed, or partially confiscated

Author: zack#6467
Content: any hard update is possible once futarchy is involved. we could reverse it or partially confiscate or do anything at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or even find out which side CSW was on and just declare the other side the winner

Author: zack#6467
Content: they are both doing the same thing symmetrically,

Author: zack#6467
Content: I don't see why we would treat them different

Author: walrus#8604
Content: Hi, Just a quick question

Content: curl --user myrpcuser:myrpcpassword --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getwalletinfo", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:myrpcport/

Author: walrus#8604
Content:
If I want to replicate the same in javascript (node.js), is it right to create an HTTP request with above mentioned parameters (with configured RPC port of asset-chain).
Is there any recommended node.js module (for webapps) to create these HTTP requests.

Content: @walrus  this might help - https://github.com/imylomylo/komodo-rpc-lib

Content: from browser you will have a CORS request problem, so just put CORS-anywhere inbetween.   works no probs.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: can whip up a readme throughout the week

Author: MyName#0491
Content: Anyone know what causes a node to continually drop peers (or at least think it has)?

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
```
$ komodo-cli -ac_name=RFOX getblocktemplate                         
error code: -9
error message:
Cannot get a block template while no peers are connected or chain not in sync!
$ komodo-cli -ac_name=RFOX getpeerinfo | jq length
26```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @MyName is getpeerinfo showing your own IP 26 times?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢

Author: MyName#0491
Content: nope

Author: MyName#0491
Content: 2 for the pool (which is a different IP and server) and all of the rest are other people's nodes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @MyName try restarting the node maybe?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
try
`komodo-cli -ac_name=RFOX getblocktemplate "{\"mode\": \"disablecb\"}"`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: same thing?

Author: MyName#0491
Content: it seems that when a "local" block (RPC) fails `komodo_check_deposit`, the daemon then decides that it has no peers for all RPC related calls and stays in that state until it gets a new block from one of the P2P peers

Author: MyName#0491
Content: after the new block from outside source, it behaves properly until another RPC block fails `komodo_check_deposit`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @MyName that sounds like a very good bug find. which branch/commit are you testing with?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @MyName and let me know the exact RPC that you tested with

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
@dukeleto it happens with labs/master and james' FSM, the oldest combination being 3 weeks ago to the newest as of 7 hrs ago
as for the calls, it's a `submitblock` that returns like `checkdeposit: ht.393534 checktoshis 0.00980000 overflow.0 total 0.01000000 strangeout.0` in stdout (obviously a fees issue in the block) and after that `getblocktemplate` fails (as does at least one of the payment calls, but I'm not sure exactly which one).
I haven't tried anything else yet because it requires such a specific fail to begin with that I can't catch inside that 60-90 second window very often.
I working on an unrelated pool that doesn't have that issue, so when I get that one done I might try creating intentionally bad blocks to see if I can force it to try other calls manually.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/zecwallet/status/1110321399187464192

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: seems like a pretty good feature that KMD wallets should learn how to do, and a great use of the memo field to do a completely shielded invoice request + payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is this such a big deal?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can just send an encrypted message in opreturn and have an autoprocessing of it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess rpc level would be sendinvoice, listinvoices, approveinvoice

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: GUI wallets supporting it easily is the big deal, bitpay/btcpay have the concept of invoices

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that stuff above purely uses the memo field, this is shielded only

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and it just parses the memo field like email headers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: to find the address/amount requested, it seems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, so making rpc for gui to use seems the thing. and memo field/opreturn, really not much different

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the above GUI needed no RPC changes at all in ZEC, I don't think

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's purely a GUI wallet feature

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: z_sendmany

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly you can code the rpc functionality the gui, so that no other gui can use the functionality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or you can put it in the core, so all gui are able to easily do this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but the wallet needs to be a bit smart to parse memo fields and save some data (sent memo fields are not saved anywhere by default, only received), and a few edge cases like that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what I am saying is that it is a one day task to implement a general invoce rpc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and what exactly are the benefits of that?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all gui can add the invoicing functionality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: confused, are you saying it is better to be a proprietary direct in the gui thing vs rpc level?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or that this invoicing has no benefits

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i don't understand why RPC level changes are wanted when it can be done at a higher level

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and GUI wallets would have to write much more code to support your new RPCs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sendinvoice address amount reason

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's mostly sending a special memo field and parsing it, some string parsing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: listinvoices

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: approveinvoice txid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is much more code than doing all the opreturn creation and parsing?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you want to add new RPCs, which means GUI wallets writing a ton of code to call them, deal with them, etc... All the code to send/receive z_sendmany should be there

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: no opreturn

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: memo fields

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sapling only, is all i care about

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am talking about taddr support

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is very different, and I can see the want for custom RPCs for that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which can also do zaddr automatically if the destination is a zaddr

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: businesses don't want to broadcast their invoices to the entire world, is my gut feeling

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: shielded invoices are very interesting to them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hence the reason I said encrypted

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i fully support you writing a proper invoicing system that nicely handles taddr + zaddr vin/vouts üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: might be a nice use of cryptoconditions, or maybe it's even simpler than that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: invoice CC sounds nice, tho

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: invoice CC would be a good learning CC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe @mrlynch can cut teeth on invoice CC on his way to the vault CC :abusedsmily: , or @blackjok3r who has become a coding monster of late

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I will stay silent on how best to implement invoice CC, consider it a puzzle

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c what API/function should I look at if I want to create new KMD wallet seed phrases from the CLI ? Not sure if I want mm or iguana or where to look

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: usually I would use agama GUI but I want to automate something and also understand how it works on a deeper level

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data "{\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"calcaddress\",\"passphrase\":\"SEED\"}"
curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data "{\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"calcaddress\",\"passphrase\":\"SEED 1\"}"

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: something like that?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
what do you want to do this for? 
MM and iguana can both use a KMD WIF as input to generate wif/address for all other coins/

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r non-digital backup of an entire wallet via seed phrase instead of backing up individual private keys or WIFs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: wasnt even aware you could enter your own seed phrase to the wallet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i don't want to

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i want to generate a new one

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not make a custom seed phrase, to be clear

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: why can't each of my wallet.dat's have a seed phrase that I can use to backup all addresses in that wallet? Why is this all so hard still?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: managing important addresses/keys is still a nightmare in 2019, and light wallets have lots of problems, but backing them up via seed phrases is still massively better than having to constantly backup wallet.dat files and managing thousands of versions of the same wallet.dat files and git repos of wallet.dat files and backups of git repos of wallet.dat files. Maybe I am just frustrated with managing wallets and all I see is it getting more complex as time goes on

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX where can I read the documentation to `calcaddress` and friends ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: do we have a website with those docs? Not sure I have seen it

Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/barterDEX/barterDEX-API.html?highlight=calcaddress#calcaddress

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: and don't fund that default address :S

Content: i want to generate a new seedphrase, versus get a private key

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: I see that I have not come across yet I don't think we have that in iguana / mm

Content: I guess I need to see how the agama GUI does it
